repo.description: Send Sir Perceval on a quest to retrieve and gather data from software repositories.
repo.name: perceval

data.body:
Based on Sphynx, prepared for ReadTheDocs.

Right now, this produces (from jgbarah/perceval repository) [this documentation in ReadTheDocs](http://perceval.readthedocs.org). Once this PR is accepted, I plan to switch ReadTheDocs to point to this repostory (master branch), so that the documentation gets rebuilt every time changes are made to the source code.

The configuration (docs/conf.py) include lines for running sphinx-apidoc, which generates automatically the docs/perceval.rst file, which is the entry point for the automatically generated documentation, produced based on the docstring comments in the source code.

The file index.rst is still a bare bones schema. It should be completed in a later patch, with more detailed information about Perceval itself.

review_comments_data.body:
It shouldn't be there any spaces around keywords and assignments.
For instance : `url=None`. The same mistake can be found in other parts of this code.

data.title: Config files for a documentation, using Sphinx.

data.body:
Add also the cache support for users.

The users in an issue are: "user", "assignee". Both of them have now extra user data retrieved from GitHub User API.

comments_data.body: Reviewed it. @acs I miss the code where you add the information about who made a comment or a change.

@sduenas all review addressed except adding user data for people doing comments and changes. I am not sure we should complete user data also for this actors. The resulting JSON could be huge and with a lot of duplicates. What do you think?

@acs you're right. We can keep these data away for the moment.

Can you check the code that I added? Do you think it's better than your proposal?

data.title: [github] Add to issues user data from the GitHub User API (email, company ...)
